page.title: 04Wolsingham Show
page.content: {Wolsingham Show,}which is held on the first weekend in September, is said to be the{oldest Agricultural Show}in the country. It takes place in fields to the east of the town. It lasts for 3 days. The main judging takes place on Saturday; attractions include sulky racing, displays, a brass band, a parade of champions and side shows. The Show attracts exhibitors, competitors, and visitors from all parts of the north of England. Wolsingham Show is the second of three local shows and is the oldest and biggest. During show weekend the market place is where the fairground sideshows are set up; dodgems, roundabouts, shooting galleries are all squeezed together. {Slides C and D}show scenes at Wolsingham Show.
